document.title: The Animal Kingdom
document.body:
Some content about the animal kingdom, including classification, habitat, and adaptations.
Classification The animal kingdom is divided into several groups, called phyla, which include invertebrates like insects and mollusks, and vertebrates such as fish, amphibians, reptiles, birds, and mammals.
Habitat Animals inhabit diverse environments, from the deep sea to the highest mountains, from arid deserts to lush rainforests, adapting to various ecological niches.
Adaptations Animals have developed various adaptations to survive and thrive in their specific environments, such as camouflage, mimicry, and specialized organs or appendages.
